algorithm_technique: Count frequencies, then find GCD of counts.
problem_summary_simple: Group cards into sets of size x > 1, where all cards in a set are identical.
problem_summary_technical: Determine if card counts have a common divisor greater than 1 using frequency maps and GCD.
key_insights: The core idea is that if a partition is possible, the count of each distinct card must be divisible by the group size 'x'.
Therefore, 'x' must be a common divisor of all card counts.
Finding the greatest common divisor (GCD) of all card counts is sufficient to determine if such an 'x' exists (x > 1).
